info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 7 at 11:21PM EDT until July 9 at 7:28AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Cape Fear River At Fayetteville affecting Cumberland County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cape Fear River at Fayetteville.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Action Stage. Banks of the Cape Fear River begin to overflow. At 35.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The boat ramp and lower parking lot at Riverside Bait and Tackle off Person Street are flooded. The stage and lower seating area at the Cape Fear amphitheater are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 32.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 37.9 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.0 feet on 02/09/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING
